comment: Now we see what Black's maneuvering was all about. He's now controlling two of the three squares the b4-pawn must traverse on its way to promotion. The promotion square can't be guarded by a White piece (the Bishop is shut out from ever defending b1). Reti sees that the b-pawn is now unstoppable and resigns.
reasoning: The comment provides a clear explanation of why the move was considered a mistake, highlighting a critical positional threat.
